First Friday and different sorority/fraternity week are cool. If your heart desire to join a frat or sorority then do. It builds your network and allows you to create a life long bond.
You must get involved in clubs activities. They are a great way to meet people and build your network. Students thrive off of networking at HU.
Dedicated, social, hard-working, determined, smart and bright
Walking to Howard China (HoChi) after parties for chicken and Mumbo sauce. Or staying late in the ILab to get papers done.

This school is majorly expensive!! I left because I did not want to take on all the loans. Even though I look ahead to a rewarding career, I did not want to have to deal with the many loans I would pay over a lifetime. You have to do a lot of hard and long networking to find scholarships and opportunities to succeed financially.

When the weather is sunny and lovely, the yard is the place to be. The students come out as one to enjoy the sunshine. There is always a social event at clubs or thrown house parties. Or its always nice to go down to China Town watch a movie or go shopping as well as in Pentagon City.

The cafe food is decent. The staff is hilarious and weird at the same time. The Punch Out used to have decent food in there when I was going there. Both are located in Blackburn and also have events in there for different activities going on around campus.

Q-U-A-D!!! AWWWWEEEE YEEEEAAAAAHHHHH!!!!!!! IF you are a incoming freshman you would want to stay in the dorms. They are a great way to meet new people and the RESFEST is a friendly competition to show the best dorms with talent. It is an older school without much remodeling except for the newer dorms. I stayed in Crandall Hall 2nd floor and didn't have many problems. Except losing my keys lol.
The academics are not tough, but if you lose focus you can easily see yourself stressing out more than you should.
Please stay focus and on top of the A Building. Also, become active around campus to obtain a better network.
I love this school. The atmosphere and student relation are wonderful. The students genuinely care for each other and expect the best for you.

textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here I absolutely LOVE the environment of Howard! There are so many different people here and I've found every person I've met to be intriguing. In my dorm, there are lots of socials that students can participate in and that will help you to meet lots of people. For instance, during the beginning of the year, my RA put together a girls night where we played games and had lots of treats to eat while getting to know each other. The residence hall council knows how to keep us interested by always decorating the lobby during Homecoming and Christmas and also throw many sessions about important issues such as recycling and campus safety. Aside from the social life, Howard has LOTS of opportunities that are open to everyone. There are so many activities to join that you may find yourself in many organizations and clubs within your first two months. I absolutely couldn't imagine going to any other school! Am learning a lot Since I'm in the School of Business the curriculum proved to be challenging. I took 15 credit hours for my first semester freshman year and I could handle it.
